entry.title: Re: SSCR not showing systems
entry.content:
As I checked, your S-user is missing below authorizations as per KBA 2453897 - How to request Object and/or Developer Keys (SSCR) for On-premise - SAP for Me

  • Register Object Keys
  • Register Object and Developer Keys

To resolve this issue, I have updated your authorizations in our backend system, you should be able to generate SSCR key now.

entry.title: Re: BTP ABAP SaaS Solution: Custom Field not available in...
entry.content:
Hi Daniel,

I think I might see where the difference comes from.

We did not change the check variant itself and are also using ABAP_CLOUD_DEVELOPMENT_DEFAULT. The change was made in the ATC Configuration, specifically under "Behavior on Transport Release", where the handling of findings is defined.

Configuration before the change, blocking the release:

Configuration after our change, allowing a successful release:

Hope this clarifies the discrepancy. Let me know if you would still like us to open an incident for this.

Best regards
Johannes

so the initial package 0-100 records are missing and in last package instead of getting 900-1000 recordd im getting 11th package which contains 1000-1100.

Thank you

entry.title: Improve Build Apps UIs to Allow Keyboard Click / Control Focus
entry.content:
I was doing this great tutorial by my colleagues @Rekha_DR and @shrinivasan_neelamegam about creating a chatbot using Build Apps and AI Core, a topic they delivered in the SAP TechEd developer keynote in 2024: https://github.com/SAP-samples/teched2024-developer-keynote/blob/main/topics/DEV100A-build-chatbot-apps-aicore/README.md

It worked perfectly. 

The tutorial let you create a chatbot where you typed a prompt, got an answer, and then could send a new prompt, like a regular chatbot. (By the way, one of the clever designs of theirs was that the context of the conversation was always sent back to the AI Core with every subsequent prompt.)

I thought what would make the app even more helpful would be:

  • To be able to press Enter after typing in each prompt.
  • To place the cursor automatically in the prompt input box so the user could just start typing the next prompt.

 

Allow Enter Instead of Button Click

To do this, you first want to create a custom event for the logic that you want connected to the button click / Enter press.

Drag a Receive Event flow function onto the canvas.

Set the Event Source to Fired from "Trigger Event", and give the event a name, like SendChat.

Attach your logic (in this case the calls to AI Core) to the event.

Now all that's left is to trigger this event when the user clicks the button, or presses Enter. 

For the button click, select the button click, drag a Trigger Event flow function, and connect it to your Component Tap event for the button.

Configure the Trigger Event flow function by selecting your new event to be triggered.

To enable the logic to be triggered by pressing Enter, highlight your input box, and create the following logic on the input box's onKeyPress event.

To the onKeyPress event, add an If Condition flow function with the following formula:

outputs["Receive event"].eventValue == "Enter"

And then to the top output add a Trigger Event, configured the same as for the button click logic above.

 

Place Cursor in Input Box

Every time I send a prompt, I want the cursor to return to the input box so I can type in the next prompt.

Install the Focus Input flow function from the Marketplace.

After the logic for sending the prompt and receiving the answer from AI Core, add this flow function and specify the input box.

üòΩ

entry.title: Re: Java VM Settings to avoid memory leaks
entry.content: JVM settings alone cannot prevent memory leaks. However, JVM settings can influence the timeframe in which memory problems can arise. In a dedicated NetWeaver AS Java system with 16 GB of physical memory, using a 4 GB Java heap is relatively conservative. If there is sufficient memory available in your operating system,  then in that case, you can go ahead and try increasing  the heap size to 6-8 GB. However, a recurring out-of-memory condition indicates a likely heap or off-heap memory leak rather than simply insufficient heap size. Analyzing GC logs to verify whether old generation memory is reclaimed after a Full GC and capturing heap dumps to identify retained objects are essential steps. Proper diagnosis and fixing the underlying cause is more effective than relying solely on JVM memory tuning to avoid memory leaks.  For a deeper understanding of common signs of a Java memory leak, identifying memory leaks by analyzing a heap dump, check out this blog,  From Symptoms to Solutions: Troubleshooting Java Memory Leaks & OutOfMemoryError.

entry.title: Multiple IBD item referencing single PO item - GR with delivery status A
entry.content:
Hi Expert,

We are facing a scenario where multiple inbound delivery (IBD) line items are referencing the same PO line item. IBD is created via EDI and partial GR is posted via IDOC. The goods movement is posted successfully using BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE. However, only one IBD item can be completed, while the remaining IBD item stays in status A (not yet processed).

For example:

PO A item 10 - qty 100

IBD item 10 - PO A item 10 - qty 60 -> GR status C

IBD item 20 - PO A item 10 - qty 40 -> GR status A

I would like to understand:

1. Is this behavior standard SAP design?

2. Is there any standard configuration or recommended approach for this case?

any guidance or best practice recommendation would be highly appreciated.

Thanks

entry.title: Re: the CDS of APP Display Actual Costing Result
entry.content:
Hi @omega-ou 

The released CDS view I_ActlCostgMatlValueChainItem can show all material movements data as those in CKM3N (material price analysis). When using this CDS view, you are required to enter costing run ID, please use I_ActCostingRunTypeVH for the costing run value help.

If you are requesting data for cost component split for each material and its movements, no CDS view exists for this purpose. See more details in CIP (customer influence platform): https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/327490.

Regards,

Grace

entry.title: Inter-company billing transfer IDOC issue(about enhance)
entry.content:
Hi All,

When we initiate an inter-company billing, the corresponding IDOC is automatically forwarded.

Now we need to set up accounting on IDOC.

The line that originally had EWLNR='*' set in OBCB, the account assignment is 51110090.

Now, a new line EWLNR='99890007' has been added, with the account assignment 70100001.

However, because one subject represents costs and the other revenue, the screen configurations are different.

This causes the following error in IDOC. Because our system's revenue category does not have a quantity field.

Is there an enhancement that allows removing the quantity on the IDOC before the throw?

Are there any other suggested approaches?

 

If anything above is unclear, please feel free to ask further questions. 

Thanks All !

entry.title: Important Quality Management TCODE | QM TCODE
entry.content:
1.     QM's Important TCODE

1.1.    QM Master Data ‚Äì Inspection Planning

1.1.1.   Master Inspection characteristics

QS21 ‚Äì Create Master Inspection Characteristic

QS22 ‚Äì Create Master Inspection Characteristic (with Version)

QS23 ‚Äì Change Master Inspection Characteristic

QS24 ‚Äì Display Master Inspection Characteristic

 

1.1.2.   Inspection plan

QP01 ‚Äì Create Inspection Plan

QP02 ‚Äì Change Inspection Plan

QP03 ‚Äì Display Inspection Plan

QP05 ‚Äì Print list for Task List

QP06 ‚Äì Missing/Unusable Inspection Plans

QP07 ‚Äì Missing/Unusable GR Inspection Plans

QP60 ‚Äì Display Inspection Plan Changes

 

1.1.3.   Sampling Procedure

QDV1 ‚Äì Create Sampling Procedure

QDV2 ‚Äì Change Sampling Procedure

QDV3 ‚Äì Display Sampling Procedure

 

1.1.4.   Code group and selected set

QS41 ‚Äì Create Catalog

QS42 ‚Äì Display Catalog

QS46 ‚Äì Display Code Group in task list

QS47 ‚Äì Replace Code Group

QS51 ‚Äì Edit Selected Set

QS52 ‚Äì Display Selected Set

QS58 ‚Äì Check Usage Indicator

 

1.1.5.   DMR or Dynamic Modification Rule

QDR1 ‚Äì Create Dynamic Modification Rule

QDR2 ‚Äì Change Dynamic Modification Rule

QDR3 ‚Äì Display Dynamic Modification Rule

 

1.1.6.   Quality Info Record

QI01 ‚Äì Create Quality Info Record

QI02 ‚Äì Change Quality Info Record

QI03 ‚Äì Display Quality Info Record

 1.1.7.   Material master

MM01 ‚Äì Create Material (QM View)

MM02 ‚Äì Change Material (QM View)

MM03 ‚Äì Display Material (QM View)

 

1.1.8.   Certificate Profile

QC01 ‚Äì Create Certificate Profile

QC02 ‚Äì Change Certificate Profile

entry.title: Primary Bank Account Selection in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

In SAP Public Cloud, when a business partner has several bank accounts maintained in the master data ‚Äîfor example, a supplier‚Äî is there any way to set a different account as the main one without having to delete the first account created?

I have carried out several tests and noticed that the system automatically takes the first bank account entered in the business partner master as the main account. To make the second account the main one, I am forced to delete the first one. Is there any option that allows selecting any account as the main one without having to remove any of the existing bank accounts?

I would really appreciate your help.

Thank you all very much.

entry.title: Strategy ‚ÄúAddition to Existing Stock‚Äù not working as expected with multiple HUs
entry.content:
Hello SAP EWM Community,

I need your help with a putaway issue in SAP EWM regarding Strategy: Addition to Existing Stock.

Scenario:

  1. I have 4 HUs in inbound delivery
  2. All HUs contain the same product
  3. Different batches
  4. All HUs should be put away into one storage type and ideally into the same storage bin

Customizing:

  1. Storage Type: Regular storage type
  2. Putaway Rule: 2 ‚Äì Addition to existing stock / empty bin
  3. Capacity Check: 2 ‚Äì Check according to packaging material
  4. Mixed storage:
  5. Mixed storage without restrictions
  6. Mixed storage without restrictions on HU level
  • Storage bin total capacity: 100,000
  • Current bin utilization: ~8% only

So from capacity and mixed storage perspective, all 4 HUs should fit into the same bin.

What happens:

I manually create warehouse tasks at the same time for all 4 HUs

For HU1, the system correctly finds Storage Bin 1

For HU2, HU3 and HU4, the system searches for and assigns different storage bins

Even though Storage Bin 1 still has enough capacity for all HUs

Expected behavior:

All HUs should be put away into the same storage bin (like HU1), since:

  • Same product
  • Mixed batches allowed
  • Capacity is sufficient
  • Putaway rule allows addition to existing stock

Question:

Why does EWM not reuse the same storage bin for HU2‚ÄìHU4?

Any hint, SAP Note, or customizing advice would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

Best regards

entry.title: Re: Regarding the transpo of filter variants per app.rt
entry.content: Hi and thanks for your question.The variants (aka "views") you're referring to are usually personal to the user that created them and cannot be moved via transports across systems. However, if certain requirements are met, views can be saved as "public" so they are available for other users. The "public" feature needs to be available and enabled for your platform to do this. If this is an option for you, please check the following documentation as an entry point: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/4fc8d03390c342da8a60f8ee387bca1a/cf0191775b1f4ba19748552991a06465.html?locale=en-US There are other key user features in this documentation that might help you to adapt UIs to your scenarios. Best regards, Oliver

entry.title: Re: Regarding the transpo of filter variants per app.rt
entry.content:
Hi and thanks for your question.

The variants (aka "views") you're referring to are usually personal to the user that created them and cannot be moved via transports across systems.

However, if certain requirements are met, views can be saved as "public" so they are available for other users. The "public" feature needs to be available and enabled for your platform to do this. If this is an option for you, please check the following documentation as an entry point (as Henrike suggested): Create Public Views.  There are other key user features in this documentation that might help you to adapt UIs to your scenarios.

Best regards, Oliver

entry.title: Re: Send an Email for an selected record Using a SAP RAP(RESTful ABAP Programming Model)
entry.content:
Hi Community,

" Metadata extensions are used to define UI-specific annotations for CDS views. They allow the separation of concerns by keeping the data model independent of UI-related semantics. These extensions are particularly useful for defining Fiori UI layouts and behaviors without modifying the underlying CDS view. "

 

Thanks for your kindly sharing, it really help us a lot.

 

 

üôÇ

 

Regards,

ZFiori.

entry.title: Re: Configure Single-Sign-On for SAP Ariba with SAP Cloud Identity Services
entry.content:
After the successful deployment we are missing a very important feature - the automatic certificate update for the SAML certificates. Running the "wizard" in SAP Ariba Intelligent Configuration Manager creates the necessary applications in the SAP CIS but the Metadata URL is always empty. This means that every time the certificates of "service-eu.ariba.com" or "s1-eu.ariba.com" are updated, one needs to manually re-download the metadata.xml from SAP Ariba and re-upload it into the SAP CIS. Apparently, the SAP CIS would attempt to update the SAML certificates if the target application das a Metadata URL available.

Other solution, like SAP SuccessFactors provide an Metadata URL that can be added to SAP CIS. Is this at least planned for SAP Ariba too? It would be very useful (actually necessary) since DigiCert intends to issue certificates with reduced lifecycle - 47 days by Mar-2029. Thanks!

entry.title: Trading Partner Management: Indentification problems
entry.content:
Hello Colleagues,

I'm exploring the first time with SAP Integration Advisor - TPM configuration and I'm struggling to make the aggremment generate a correct trading partner ID reflect the reallity, after active the agreement, look the configuration below:

I'm testing the SOAP cenario Inbound in SAP CPI and I created the soap envelop with flat-file of ODETTE EDIFACT A96 S3 ORDERS:

Manually created SOAPEnvelop with FLAT FILE CDATA:

<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:n0="http://sap.com/xi/SAPGlobal20/Global">
    <soapenv:Header/>
    <soapenv:Body>
        <n0:PurchaseOrderERPRequest_In>
            <MessageHeader>
                <ID>MSG_ODETTE_2026_999</ID>
                <CreationDateTime>2026-01-14T12:00:00Z</CreationDateTime>
                <SenderParty>
                    <InternalID schemeID="N/A" schemeAgencyID="ZZ" schemeAgencyName="ODETTE_EDIFACT">EXT.EDI</InternalID>
                </SenderParty>
                <RecipientParty>
                    <InternalID schemeID="N/A" schemeAgencyID="" schemeAgencyName="SAP">SAP</InternalID>
                </RecipientParty>
                <BusinessScope>
                    <TypeCode>PROCESS_ID</TypeCode>
                    <InstanceID>ODETTE_D96A_S3</InstanceID>
                </BusinessScope>
            </MessageHeader>
            <PurchaseOrder>
                <Payload>
                    <![CDATA[UNA:+.? '
UNB+UNOA:2+EXT.EDI:ZZ+SAP+260114:1830+REF12345'
UNH+1+ORDERS:D:96A:UN:S3'
BGM+220+PO999888777+9'
DTM+137:20260114:102'
PAI+:::42'
FTX+ZZZ+1++INSTRUCTIONS'
RFF+ON:4500001234'
NAD+BY+ID007::92'
NAD+SU+I008::92'
CUX+1:EUR:9'
LIN+1++PART-12345:IN'
QTY+21:1000:PCE'
DTM+2:202602011000:203'
UNS+S'
UNT+15+1'
UNZ+1+REF12345']]>
                </Payload>
            </PurchaseOrder>
        </n0:PurchaseOrderERPRequest_In>
    </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

Header:  UNB+UNOA:2+EXT.EDI:ZZ+SAP+260114:1830+REF12345'

Company Dummy:

I already setup the system and communication channel.

The indentifiers from the company

Indentifiers from the partner:

Created the agreement and active the agreement:

Agrement with MIG Sender, MAG and MIG Receiver:

The receiver channel in SAP basicalling I'm sending the result of the mapping in another endpoint in SAP CPI.

Agreement unic ID from trading partner:

SOAP-ODETTE_EDIFACT--D.96A S3-EXT.EDI-ZZ----EXT.EDI-ZZ----ORDERS - Wrong, it's always failed in the 2 Iflow Stantard 

Error:

javax.script.ScriptException: java.lang.Exception: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Partner ID SAP_TPM_467257935cff5475cbc45359b4ba5bc7 is not available.

It's like opositive way but I can't find the reason.

Partner Directory Lookup Keys:

SOAP-ODETTE_EDIFACT--D.96A S3-EXT.EDI-ZZ----SAP-----ORDERS

Agremment Plan ID:

SOAP-ODETTE_EDIFACT--D.96A S3-EXT.EDI-ZZ----EXT.EDI-ZZ----ORDERS

Someone could provide me support ?

Regards,

Viana

entry.title: installation Number Hardware is Expired in System Managed - SAP for Me
entry.content:
We have a newly built Solution Manager dev system (DSA). When we're trying to register developer's key, the system can't be seen in the list of systems. When I checked in the systems managed, installation number DIGITS has hardware expired. But we're able to generate license key on this installation number. I can't also see the system here so I choose SMP to be able to proceed with this request.

We already sent email to sapcontractcenter@sap.com to update the hardware information in installation number DIGITS but still no automated email received for the ticket number.

Question and Answer:
Q: Please categorize your issue by choosing the option below that best fits your scenario.
A: Cannot register SSCR key?



Manually selected component: XX-SER-FORME
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: SAP Enterprise Support Academy Newsletter January 2026
entry.content:
Dear customers,
Find here an overview of the SAP Enterprise Support Academy monthly newsletter on latest news, training courses, upcoming sessions, and further educational offerings.
The SAP Enterprise Support Academy provides expert guidance and high impact knowledge transfer services that enable you to innovate and be successful with your SAP solutions.

Subscribe to regularly receive latest news and stay informed about the wide range of educational offerings provided by the SAP Enterprise Support Academy that help you to build the digital skills tailored to your needs.

Revamped Expert-guided Implementation ‚Äì SAP Analytics Cloud BI & Planning

Boost your SAP Analytics Cloud expertise with our redesigned EGI workshops! Join hands-on sessions covering BI, planning, connectivity, security, smart features, and Generative AI with SAP Joule. New format: 2 hrs/day for 4 days. Seats are limited.

Check this blog and secure your spot

Learning within the customer insights

Discover the new learning section in the Customer Insights Dashboard (CID) ‚Äì providing clear insights into your organization‚Äôs enablement activities with SAP Enterprise Support Academy content. Track learning engagement, analyse delivery methods, and identify your most consumed assets at a glance.

Learn more

SAP Cloud ERP Early Release Series

Join our SAP Cloud ERP Early Release Series for an exclusive preview of the innovations shipping with the 2602 release. From January 12 to 16, 2026, engage with product experts in 22 live sessions covering AI-driven features, expert demos, and real-time Q&A.

Register for the sessions relevant to you

A practical guide on how to get started with SAP Business Network

Discover how SAP Business Network enables effective collaboration with suppliers to create a stronger and more reliable supply chain with a portfolio of solutions across procurement, supply chain, logistics, and asset management.

Getting started with SAP Business Network

Unlocking extensibility and integration in SAP Cloud ERP

Take the new e-learning course and learn about the extension framework and extensibility options available in SAP Cloud ERP, including key user, developer, and side-by-side extensibility. Drive project success and boost user adoption by the different extension options.

Enroll now for practical, project-ready takeaways.

SAP S/4HANA Finance fundamentals ‚Äì deep dive

Join us in a multiday training session to discover everything you need to know about delta capabilities in SAP S/4HANA Finance. The next session will take place from January 12-15.

More in this blog post

Conversion to SAP S/4HANA Finance ‚Äì deep dive

Join us in a multiday training session to discover everything you need to know about all phases and activities involved in Conversion of Accounting to SAP S/4HANA. We have a new session upcoming in January.

More in this blog post

Getting started with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public edition

This e-learning introduces SAP Cloud ERP, also known as SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. It outlines the landscape, explores system access, and describes user onboarding activities. The course covers the SAP Activate Methodology, SAP Cloud Application Lifecycle Management, and obtaining support from SAP, including SAP Enterprise Support features such as continuous quality checks and value maps.

Start today!

A new era of support ‚Äì join our executive series & Cape Town event

Explore the future of SAP's Support ‚Äì strategic, proactive, AI-driven. Join AFSUG and SAP for four insightful remote sessions, starting Nov 27, culminating in an exclusive Cape Town event, Mar 2026. Engage with SAP executives, learn how SAP mitigates risks, scales AI safely, and drives continuous optimization. Don't miss this opportunity!

Check out this blog and be sure to register for the sessions

AI on the frontline: SAP's strategy for Customer Support

Learn more about how SAP‚Äôs Customer Support harnesses agentic AI to deliver smarter assistance, faster resolutions, and a stronger human‚Äìtech partnership.

Learn more

Proactive monitoring and shift left for Black Friday and Cyber Monday

This holiday season, stability is more than just a wish‚Äîit‚Äôs a strategy. See how proactive monitoring, fueled by AI and Collective Intelligence, breaks data silos to predict disruption, speed root-cause analysis, and ensure uninterrupted retail operations.

Read the blog

SAP Innovation Awards 2026 - submissions are now open!

For 13 years, the SAP Innovation Awards have celebrated organizations that have turned transformation into reality by using SAP‚Äôs cloud and AI technologies to take on real-world challenges and deliver results that matter. The annual program honors those who act with purpose and turn innovation into a reality ‚îÄ benefiting businesses, communities, and individuals worldwide. What‚Äôs in it for you:
‚Ä¢ Showcase your company‚Äôs innovation
‚Ä¢ Win an exclusive trophy and SAP Sapphire pass or a US$1,000 Global Giving voucher
‚Ä¢ Amplify your story through SAP channels and media

Visit the website to learn more and enter by February 20, 2026.

Related links:

  • SAP Support Portal
  • SAP Enterprise Support value maps 
  • Video

entry.title: AI innovations highlights in SAP Cloud ERP 2602
entry.content:
The release of SAP Cloud ERP 2602 continues SAP‚Äôs focus on embedding intelligence directly into business processes, quietly, purposefully, and where it matters most. In this blog, you‚Äôll find a guided look at the key AI innovations introduced with the 2602 release, as highlighted in the product blog post by Bert Schulze. Rather than showcasing AI as a standalone capability, the focus is on how these innovations support customers in running, adapting, and evolving their core business processes across finance, sales, manufacturing, procurement, and beyond.

With the 2602 release, SAP Cloud ERP builds on its existing foundation by supporting everyday work with intelligence that is more contextual, connected, and task focused. At the heart of this evolution is an agentic AI framework, where specialized, task-specific agents take on clearly defined responsibilities based on real business context, data, and rules. These agents work together behind the scenes, while Joule serves as the orchestration layer that brings insights, recommendations, and next steps together in a natural, conversational way. Whether supporting a finance expert with complex classifications or helping teams respond faster to operational issues, intelligence is applied exactly where decisions are made. Take a moment to explore the accompanying video for a closer look at how these AI-driven capabilities quietly support everyday work and point toward a more adaptive way of running enterprise processes.

Take a look at the short video below to see how these AI-driven capabilities quietly support everyday work and are shaping a more adaptive way of running enterprise processes.

 

Agentic AI use case highlights

Finance

International Trade Classification Agent (beta)

When a single misclassified product can delay a shipment or trigger compliance questions, international trade classification quickly becomes a task where precision matters as much as speed. Inthe 2602 release, the International Trade Classification Agent supports product classification specialists in this sensitive part of the process by reasoning over product characteristics and applicable trade regulations. It proposes customs tariff numbers and commodity codes and explains how each recommendation was derived, making review and approval straightforward. This shifts the expert‚Äôs role from manual lookup to informed validation, while keeping full transparency and auditability. In practice, teams can expect significantly less effort spent on repetitive classification tasks, up to a 50% reduction, while lowering the risk of non-compliance.

 

Accounting Accruals Agent

Period-end accruals are a familiar pressure point in finance: important, repetitive, and often constrained by tight timelines. The beta version of the Accounting Accruals Agent tackles this challenge by supporting teams with proposing accruals based on accounting policy documents, historical data, and calculated values, helping shift the work from manual preparation to focused review. Accrual proposals are presented directly in the ‚ÄòManage Accrual Proposals‚Äô app, along with clear explanations that show how each figure was derived. This transparency makes it easier for general ledger accountants to validate and post accruals with confidence, without losing control over the process. As a result, teams can reduce the time spent on period-end activities while maintaining consistency and auditability, supporting a smoother close cycle.

For more information, see Accounting Accruals Agent.

 

Embedded AI highlights

Sales

Automatic creation of sales orders from unstructured data (premium) - AnyDOX adoption

Sales teams often receive purchase orders in formats that don‚Äôt fit neatly into systems, PDFs attached to emails, scanned documents, or images that still require careful manual entry. With the current release, internal sales representatives can upload these unstructured files and let the system extract the relevant information into a sales order request, proposing values such as the sold-to party based on the document content. What used to be a repetitive transcription task becomes a short review step, allowing sales teams to focus more on customer interactions and less on administrative work. Multilanguage support and the ability to train the extraction logic through SAP Document AI help ensure the process works reliably across regions and document types. The result is a smoother order intake process that reduces manual effort while keeping sales operations responsive and consistent.

Check out this dedicated page on SAP Help Portal to learn more.

 

Finance

Period comparisons and AI insights for product profitability review booklet

Looking at product profitability often starts with a simple question: What changed and why? The latest enhancements to the product profitability review booklet help sales accountants explore this question more systematically by introducing period comparisons for margins and cost of goods sold. Built-in views for margin overview and COGS breakdown are complemented by AI-generated insights that highlight notable developments between periods, offering guidance on where a closer look may be worthwhile. Additional dimensions, functional currency display, and an extensible CDS view support more flexible market segment analysis without losing consistency. Together with the new commenting feature, this creates a clearer, more connected view of product performance that supports informed discussions and decisions.

For more information, discover enhancements in the product profitability review booklet.

 

Manufacturing

AI-assisted production routing proposal and copy routing

Creating a new production routing often starts by searching for something that already exists and adapting it to fit, an approach that works, but takes time and careful attention. The newly introduced innovation, AI-assisted production routing proposal and copy routing, supports production engineers, planners, and master data specialists by identifying similar routings based on material names, descriptions, and bills of material. Instead of rebuilding routings from the ground up, users receive suggestions they can copy and adjust, turning setup work into a focused refinement step. This helps reduce repetitive data entry and lowers the risk of inconsistencies across routings. Over time, teams benefit from faster setup, more consistent master data, and a smoother path from planning to production.

Eager to learn more? Check out our dedicated pages on intelligent scenario to find similar materials for routing proposal and creating a routing using the AI-assisted material search.

 

 

Cross topic: Situation handling

AI-assisted situation handling (beta)

When critical issues surface in day-to-day operations, the real challenge is often not awareness but knowing what to do next. This is where AI-assisted situation handling comes into play, supporting business users by complementing automated alerts with context-aware guidance tailored to their roles and responsibilities. By capturing situation data together with its business context, the system can generate targeted recommendations that help users assess options and act more quickly. Customizable prompts and the ability to incorporate data from SAP, third-party, and external sources ensure that advice reflects real operational conditions. In practice, this leads to faster resolution of situations, cutting response times by up to 70%, and helps teams stay focused on decisions rather than diagnostics.

 

 

Joule innovations highlights

Procurement

Conversational search for local and central purchase requisition status

Tracking the status of a purchase requisition often means switching between apps, systems, and document numbers just to answer a simple question. With the latest updates, conversational search in Joule allows procurement users to ask directly about the status of local or central purchase requisitions and their follow-on documents, without navigating into multiple SAP Fiori apps. Users can reference familiar identifiers, such as requisition numbers, connected-system document IDs, or SAP Ariba cart numbers and receive the relevant status in one place. This shortens the path from question to answer and reduces interruptions in daily work. Over time, procurement teams gain faster visibility into requisition progress and can respond to inquiries with greater confidence and less effort.

 

Conversational search for centrally managed purchase requisition status

Similarly to the innovation described above, conversational search in Joule allows users to check the approval and follow-on document status of centrally managed purchase requisitions without switching between SAP Fiori apps. A simple query is enough to see whether a requisition has progressed to a purchase order, acknowledgment, goods receipt, or invoice receipt. This removes friction from everyday follow-ups and helps teams stay informed without interrupting their workflow. As a result, procurement professionals can respond faster to internal requests and keep processes moving smoothly.

 
Conversational search for central procurement business documents

In central procurement , finding the right document often means knowing exactly where to look and having the time to navigate there. With this release conversational search in Joule allows users to search and filter central procurement business documents simply by asking, whether they are looking for contracts nearing expiration, rejected supplier confirmations, or purchase orders tied to a specific supplier or system. Results are presented together with direct navigation links to the relevant SAP Fiori apps, turning search into a natural entry point rather than a separate task. This makes it easier to move from question to action without breaking focus. Over time, procurement teams gain faster access to the information they need and more confidence in managing centrally governed processes.

 

Don‚Äôt miss: The GenAI extensibility assistant

As we roll out the new 2602 features, we also want to highlight a game-changer from the previous cycle that is rapidly becoming a standard for key users. If you haven't yet explored the GenAI-based extensibility assistant, now is the time. This tool allows key users to generate custom fields and logic simply by describing their requirements in natural language. It‚Äôs not just about speed; it ensures your logic is consistent and "clean core" compliant by design. To see this assistant in action and learn how to enable it, check out this deep dive on extensibility assistant for key users.

 

Summary 

üìΩ Register for our SAP Cloud ERP 2602 Early Release Series! 

Between January 12-16, we are hosting a series of 22 expert-led live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the SAP Cloud ERP 2602 release. On our landing page you can register for the entire series or pick the sessions most relevant to you. 

üîé Find all our assets  

The release 2602 showcases more than 130 innovation highlights across the portfolio. Check out our release document for all the details!

We at Cloud ERP and SCM Product Success offer a service as versatile as our product itself. Check out the numerous offerings our team has created for you below:

entry.title: Re: Maintenance operation status is changed back to "In P...
entry.content:
Hi Simon,

You are right, that is not the intended standard behaviour. The execution of YA02 order type should be the same as YA01 here.

When you click "assign to me", the standard behaviour is to keep that operation visible in the Perform Maintenance Job app, and it adds your ID to the "Person Responsible" on the Work Order operation. It should not be reverting back a status/subphase as you mentioned.

Read up on the app here: https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F5104A')/S35

There are a few configuration settings for that app in SSCUI "Define Control Parameters for Perform Maintenance Job" which you can browse, but none of them are related to your issue.

In your project, have you activated any BADI's at the Work Order level? perhaps some of your custom logic/code is triggering the reset upon work order save?

If you have not done any coding extensions, I would recommend raising a support ticket as someone would need to check exactly what is being triggered upon Work Order save here.

Few screenshots below of my public cloud environment:

Operation assigned to me, stays in list:

Phase Execution, Subphase Ready for Execution:

Cheers, Tim

entry.title: Re: Customized Chart of Account in S/4 HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
You can create own CoA but it can be assigned to company code only as an alternative CoA.

YCOA is default for every company code as operational CoA. You can renumber accounts to your own numbering but you will still need to do the mapping because renumbering requires to give input in pairs : old_number-> new_number

entry.title: SF Recruiting Operators are not able to edit or view filed values in job requisitions
entry.content:
Hello Experts. After the last SF release we faced with the issue when recruiting operators are not able to edit some fields in job requisitions in pre-approved status when the job requisition is sent to them for approval. It worked in the past but stopped at some point. What is weird that it impacted some fields. Picklist fields and Recruiting team with operators. For example, HR Manager receives the job requisition in the HR Manager review route map step but when HR Manager tries to update some if the details such as Job function, Employment type, etc which are picklist fields, he cannot do it. There is no input area available for these fields. Also, recruiting operators assigned to the job requisition are not visible any more. Only field titles. The only field HR can edit is Recruiting Team operator field. I checked the template fields permissions and all looks ok. Does anyone have an idea what can cause it? Did you hear other companies complaining about it? I attached screenshots of what it looks like in the system. Any assistance or advise is highly appreciated. 

BR

Anastasia

entry.title: Re: SAP OData to MCP Server running on BTP
entry.content:
Hi @WouterLemaire ,

Thanks for sharing this. Actually , we were able to deploy this mcp server successfully on the BTP subaccount.

Only change we tried was we are now trying to access this BTP server using SAP Joule

We have developed SAP Joule agent and trying to add above MCP server in it through destination

We have created a destination for this mcp server (OAuth2ClientCredentials) and provided the necessary information eg clientid, clientsecret etc, we have also added additional property in destination - "sap-joule-studio-mcp-server" to true

However, we are unable to add it in mcp server tab, its showing error as following

Unable to find MCP server tools for destination S09ODATAMCP. Streamable HTTP error: Error POSTing to endpoint: {"error":"Token Validation Failed","message":"The provided JWT token is invalid or expired","details":"Jwt token with audience: [ 'uaa', 'XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX' ] is not issued for these clientIds: [ 'XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX', 'btp-sap-odata-to-mcp-server-CrossIndustry!t150772' ].","next_steps":{"if_expired":"Get a fresh token from http://xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxmcp-server.cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/authorize","if_refresh_available":"Try refreshing your token at http://xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxmcp-server.cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/refresh","if_invalid":"Ensure you are using a valid SAP BTP XSUAA token"},"authentication":{"endpoints":{"authorize":"http://xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxmcp-server.cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/authorize","refresh":"http://xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxmcp-server.cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/refresh","userinfo":"http://xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxmcp-server.cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/userinfo"},"token_info":{"typical_lifetime":"1 hour","refresh_lifetime":"24 hours","issuer":"https://xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.authentication.eu10.hana.ondemand.com"}}}

Seems that there is some authorization issue

Any additional config is required if we are using some different AI client? 

Can you please comment on this issue?

Regards,

entry.title: FPM Custom Page: How to parameterize value help in Macro FilterBar based on current object ID
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I am working with an FPM Custom Page that is accessed via internal navigation, where the page context is a single business object ID.

This page displays the main object along with several 1:n associated entities. For these associations, I am using a Macro FilterBar to allow the user to filter the results based on multiple fields.

The issue is related to value help (value list) behavior in the filter bar:

  • The value helps are generic and not context-aware.

  • They currently show all possible values, regardless of the selected business object ID.

  • As a result, users see value help entries that are not relevant for the current object context.

What I would like to achieve is:

  • Parameterize or filter the value help lists in the Macro FilterBar

  • So that the available values are restricted to those related to the current business object ID

  • Ideally done programmatically or via supported FPM mechanisms

I have checked the FPM Explorer and the API Reference, but I could not find a documented way to influence or filter the value help content of a Macro FilterBar based on the page context.

Is there a recommended or supported approach to:

  • Pass contextual parameters (such as the object ID) to value helps?

  • Or dynamically restrict value help entries in an FPM Custom Page?

Any guidance, hints, or architectural recommendations would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance

entry.title: Re: Customized Chart of Account in S/4 HANA Public Cloud

entry.title: Re: Document Splitting in Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello,

In this post, the answer can help you. 

''Customers cannot deactivate document splitting in S4HC. This is outlined in SAP note 2868475 - SSCUI: Define Document Splitting Characteristics for General Ledger. in the note it does mention the option to create an expert configuration request but still this may not allow to deactivate completely

also once deactivated this would not be able to reactivate later as this would not correct previously posted documents. This is the same on premise where you end up with a conversion.

What you can do is set a constant profit center for non assigned transactions in SSCUI 120100 and in this way although updated the user should not have to enter this

David''

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/deactivating-document-splitting-in-s-4hana-cloud/qaq-p/12378510

entry.title: Clarification on Data Migration Activities ‚Äì Split Valuation
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to get some clarification regarding the data migration activities for the split valuation activation:

  • For the material master, can we use MM17 to change the valuation category?
  • Is it possible to use Migration Cockpit to create valuation type data in the accounting view? If not, what is the recommended approach?
  • For the stock load with split valuation, can we use Migration Cockpit? If not, what is the best practice?

 

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,

entry.title: Re: CDS View or API of purchasing price condition data (T...
entry.content:
Hello,

I have the same issue, recommendation is to combine these two views 

  1. C_PURCHASINGINFORECORDDEX ‚Äì Data Extraction for Purchasing Info Record

  2. I_PURGPRCGCNDNRECORDSCALE ‚Äì Pricing Scale in Purchasing 

But to join these two , first you have to join it with CDS view C_PURGINFORECDPRICECNDNDEX, which i cannot find in the system it seems like it is not available as a standard? 

thanks for support

entry.title: Trading Partner Management: Error reading number range ICN_UN_EDIFACT
entry.content:
Hello Collegues,

I'm trying to text the stantard SAP CPI Iflow - Step 2 - Interchange Processing Flow V2 - for SAP TPM - SAP Integration Advisor and always failed in this step:

Error: javax.script.ScriptException: java.lang.Exception: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Error reading number range ICN_UN_EDIFACT @ line 46 in setControlNumbers.groovy, cause: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Error reading number range ICN_UN_EDIFACT

Than I check the configurarion of the partner in the SAP TPM:

SAP CPI number range:

Than I decided to replicate the stantard groovy script in another Iflow to test:

Trace:

Number range modifed:

The code basically extracting the main property the type of number range that comes from:

def recInterchangeControlNumberType = properties.get("SAP_EDI_REC_Interchange_Control_Number_Type");

The same code below I tested in another Iflow and works.

 

Calling getAPI NumberRangeConfigurationService.class
def NRCS = ITApiFactory.getApi(NumberRangeConfigurationService.class, null);
Checking if the property SAP_EDI_REC_Interchange_Control_Number_Type is null.
if (recInterchangeControlNumberType == null){
        recInterchangeControlNumberType = "ICN_DEFAULT";
    }
    try {
             // Variable receive if there is something there
 	    recInterchangeControlNumber = NRCS.getNextValuefromNumberRange(recInterchangeControlNumberType, null);
 	   	recGroupControlNumber       = recInterchangeControlNumber;
 	   	recMessageNumber            = recInterchangeControlNumber;
 	  
 	    if (recGroupControlNumberType != null){
 		    recGroupControlNumber = NRCS.getNextValuefromNumberRange(recGroupControlNumberType, null);
 	    }
 		
 	    if (recMessageNumberType != null){
 		    recMessageNumber = NRCS.getNextValuefromNumberRange(recMessageNumberType, null);
 	    }
    } catch(Exception e){
        throw new IllegalStateException("Error reading number range " + recInterchangeControlNumberType);
    }

Before the groovy the property that comes in the stantard iflow:

If you have faced this before, let me know.

Regards,

Viana.

entry.title: Converting to the 3-System Landscape ‚Äì Part 1: What‚Äôs in It for You
entry.content:
Co-Author: Dennis Leslie

For quite some time now, the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, 3-system landscape has been generally available to our customers. In this landscape, SAP Central Business Configuration is leveraged for implementation, ongoing adaptation and extension of business processes.

This is a significant upgrade from the previous 2-system landscape. For the implementation and ongoing adaptation and extension of business processes, early customers used the so-called Manage Your Solution app. Later adopters were fortunate to use SAP Central Business Configuration from the start.

Now, both 2-system landscape setups can be converted to the advanced 3-system landscape, unlocking numerous benefits, such as:

  • An additional test system for enhanced stability
  • Localization as a self-service for SAP S/4HANA Cloud supporting ~160 countries/regions
  • The parallel line feature for safe testing of data migration and business process extensions
  • Comprehensive extensibility options
  • Additional scope items and configuration settings

Stay tuned for our next blog posts in this blog series and explore the power of the 3-system landscape today! To learn more, check out the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Three-System Landscape page on SAP Community.

Going forward, SAP plans to build more features only available in the 3-system landscape as the capabilities provided by SAP Central Business Configuration and the 3-system landscape are required for these new innovations. To learn more about the advantages and the availability of features that require the 3-system landscape, please see SAP Note 3643616.

If you liked this blog, please leave us a thumbs up at the top. Also, make sure to follow the SAP Central Business Configuration tag or follow this dedicated blog collection to stay up to date with the latest blog posts.

entry.title: Re: SAP Central Business Configuration ‚Äì Blog Collection
entry.content: New blog alert ‚àí Check out our latest blog post: "Converting to the 3-System Landscape ‚Äì Part 1: What‚Äôs in It for You"
